Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: ttill
Reviews.Content: Just left Napa, had a very nice room and greatly appreciated the comfortable bed and bathroom (hubby loved the shower). We didn't eat here or try the spa, as we got up and traveled each day we were there. Toured all over the region and had a great trip. This is a "hotel" with fine services, nice rooms but it's not recommended if you truly want a small, special experience. We would probably book in St. Helena, Yountville or even Healdsburg or Sonoma. But again, this hotel offers a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stop in wine country.”
Reviews.Author: LynnS1
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Groupon, we had a chance to stay at this resort for a couple of nights at a great rate. The resort still going thru renovations, but nothing that was being worked on hindered our stay. We did get to select a room on the third floor - overlooking the pool and the vineyards. The tasting room in the cave was cool - and the wines were enjoyable. Had breakfast brought by room service - yikes $40 for meals that should have been no more than probably 20, but this is California. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would recommend this resort for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kaydee7
Reviews.Content: We had a Groupon deal that could not be beat. We were welcomed at the front door. Front desk staff was very friendly. Room was huge and very nice. Not big on decor but certainly very spacious with all the usual....beds, desk, dresser, large closet, etc. Their wine tasting cave is fun. The personnel is amazing. So friendly. Liked their wines quite a bit as well. The spa is amazing and we had excellent massages and facials. The pool and spa area is large and was never full, although it was a beautiful day outside. We had Sunday brunch buffee at their Siena restaurant. Very good and reasonably priced, especially for a resort buffee. My only issue is that the beds are on the hard side. Also want to respond to the person who wrote on here that they aren't keeping up with maintenance, etc. Um, the resort is only 5 years old and looks great. The downside right now is that they are building a new wing. The construction starts early for a Saturday morning but then, that's why they were offering the amazing deal. Don't accept a deal and then say it wasn't perfect. It seems it's only fair to expect perfect when you're paying rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Watch out for additional fees.”
Reviews.Author: Jaren2010
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal on this hotel from Travelzoo and were excited to stay here. The facility was beautiful and luxurious but in a rather out of the way location. Our stay was pleasant with no real complaints until we received our bill the morning of checkout. Having already pre-paid for our stay through Travel Zoo, we were rather shocked to find that they charged us an additional $65 in resort fees and taxes for our two night stay! This may be nothing for higher end patrons, but for a newly married couple on a budget, these ridiculous fees pretty much left a bad taste in our mouth. Our overall experience was pleasant and this is a nice place, but i doubt we would visit again and certainly would not reccomend to those who are price conscious or looking for a deal :(

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation of our lives”
Reviews.Author: Denise V
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was the best vacation of our lives. What a grand facility. Everything was perfect. We were treated like royalty. I cannot say enough. If you call him, my husband will not stop raving to you about how wonderful everything was. We live in San Ramon CA and have visited Hawaii, Arizona, Oregon, Anaheim, Donatello, Opera House, Fisherman's Wharf, Seattle and lots more of the Shell sites in the last 8 years, but this was the best. Just a 45 minute drive to the Garden of Eden and we are just now finding out about it. We spent the entire day on 03/30/2012 in the Spa. It was my birthday and we had a couples exfoliation, massage and lunch in the Spa with Victoria giving us great service. Francisco tended to my husband's every wish and the therapists were remarkable (Jennifer, Edith, et al). We spent 7 hours in there. All of the women at the spa front desk went overboard and killed us with kindness. Caitlin put together the couples package for us two days before on the phone and we were very happy with what she did. We went to dinner in Yountville at Bistro Jeantry and returned for room service by Ulrecht (from Haiti) who sang Happy Birthday to me in French and presented a chocolate cake with a candle that he lit. We had decafs with it (great coffee in the rooms, by the way, not any cheap stuff!) We went to sleep with a movie on one of five free Starz channels. We woke up to room service breakfast and went to Saturday 8:30 am Mass in the Chapel. What a splendid facility and the visiting priest from Chicago was so warm and caring. My husband did the readings to the sparse congregation. (Perhaps you could advertise it better in the hotel, as we were the only ones there for Palm Sunday Mass on Saturday at 5:30.) After morning Mass we went back to the spa for another day of lazing around doing nothing but sauna, steam, relax, massage, facial Bellisima, lunch, champagne, pampering, apples, tea, sauna, spa, relax. We walked back to the room in our robes and got ready for Palm Sunday Mass and then ate at the Siena. Rafael gave us fantastic service from 8:00 to 10:30 as he catered to our every desire bringing us appetizers and pairing wines to every dish. He was great and so was the food. The manager came by and talked with us and we complained about Yelpers together. We got a free DVD and popcorn from the front desk and had a nightcap in bed after spending time in the spa in the room. We had a hard time waking up on Sunday and finally made it back to Bistro Jeantry for a lunch from 2:30 to 5:00 and back to the Meritage when we realized that we had yet to visit a winery. So we went the the Trinitas on the property and closed the place down and walked back to the room for another night of DVDs, popcorn room service and heaven. The very best part of all: we hadn't been on vacation for a while, so we converted our points to Spa dollars and Dining dollars. We plan to repeat this again for our 10th anniversary on June 29!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay despite the cold weather”
Reviews.Author: justakiwi
Reviews.Content: Three nights here for a conference. Very comfortable and amazing - its pet friendly. Great room, good food, friendly staff. Weather was cold so the outdoor setting didn't work so well - but overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: youbake
Reviews.Content: We used a TravelZoo voucher for what was marketed as a "deal". The first impression was the overwhelming construction happening at the resort. In addition, the front enterance was under repair and so you had to walk thru a side enterance, poorly market, lacking any proper signage or help and assistance from staff. When we arrived, there was some rain and the inconveniance was a beginning to a poor stay. The facility is not well maintained. Fixtures and furnishings are worn and tired. Staff lacks appropriate level of friendliness and energy. Shower in room was the nightmare hot to cold and cold to hot in seconds during your shower, OUCH! Room was minumal with decor and set-up. Again, remodeling in the lobby was shabby. Not alot of communications or assistance on the part of the resort to accomidate guests thru the "dust". Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: susanweisinger
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort in area of corporate offices. Seemed similar in quality to Bacarra Resort in Goleta. We stayed in the condo which was gorgeous with granite kitchen amazing dishes and utensils with even cheese tray and wine. It felt like home away from home. We had brunch which was fair not exceptional but would definitely stay there again. Got a great rate on Bloomspot.

Reviews.Title: “Napa”
Reviews.Author: JSarbello
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels in the area to handle a large corporate gathering in style. Pulling up to the resort you have to go through a corporate business park (a little wierd for being in Napa). The facility has everything you need (like most resorts). The Wine Cave is a very attractive and unique (but not soley unique) feature. The spa is world class - you do have the ability to take advantage of parts of the spa without having to book packages. My room, on the first floor was perfect for me - spacious - luxurious and convenient. Opened out to the pool and right by the entrance to the 'Cave'. I had a function that basically utilized the entire resort one night and the set-up by the pool, into the conference rooms & into the cave was superb. Quality of service and food was impeccable. Entering into the cave with live music, candles, etc at nite was quite unique & fun. The bar area in the main hall of the hotel is small, but quite adequate with great service. Would recommend staying here, especially of you are part of a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway to visit wine country”
Reviews.Author: we_scuba2
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable for our three day stay. We actually appreciated the location for our daily wine country explorations. Convenient to Napa where we went to eat each night. They had a free shuttle to Napa which we used to get to and from the Wine Train(nice experience and did not want to be driving afterwards). The grounds are nice and they have a wine cave in the side of a hill in the back of the property. We enjoyed a few hours there and even bought some of their wine. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a resort”
Reviews.Author: GMTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: The arrival experience was poor. No staff at the front to greet or assist with check-in. The Front Desk Agent was efficient and provided a very good explanation of the "resort". The rooms were average. We found the beds uncomfortable as described in other reviews. The windows overlooking the pool were dirty (dirt, water stains, bird droppings) and didn't allow us to enjoy the view of the pool. Our room also provided us with a view of the back side of the property where the hotel GM and other staff members would stand and smoke cigarettes while they watched the construction project go on next door. One morning I watched the hotel GM smoke his cigarette, put it out on the ground, and then kick the cigarette butt into the flower bed. Nice touch. I know it was the GM because I saw him later in the stay and I asked the staff who he was. Back to the room; when set on cool, the A/C fan made a noise so we just slept with the windows open. Siena made for a poor dining experience. The staffing levels were poor (as stated in other reviews) and the service skills of the staff were worse. Unfortunately, we had the same server for breakfast two days in a row. Both days, she poured coffee on the floor as she wrote down our order. The spills stayed on the floor during the meals. On the second day, after our order was placed on the table, we asked for our check. The check didn't arrive until after we completed the meal and we had to ask for it, again. We had more poor service examples but these make the point. We planned to eat there more often but the train wreck service and average food drove us away. Try Mustards Grill in Yountville. It was awesome the 2 times we went. We also had fantastic meals at Cyrus and the Wine Spectator Restaurant at CIA. My wife did enjoy the spa treatment. In my opinion, they call it a "resort" so they can charge a "resort fee". It has a bar, a restaurant, and room service. It has a pool and a hot tub. There is a spa. However, most high profile hotels in large cities have these amenities and they don't call themselves a resort. Having a tasting room, which are everywhere in this part of CA, doesn't make you a resort. We were disappointed and will look to stay someplace else on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good things but...”
Reviews.Author: creativity2001
Reviews.Content: Many good things about the Meritage. Nice rooms - they gave me a complimentary upgrade because it was my birthday and even slipped a birthday card under my door. The amenities were good, including a free bottle of wine (though it was part of the resort fee so free may be a misnomer). Except for really good tomato soup, the food at the restaurant was average though the price was reasonable so it wasn't all that bad. We were there on Groupon making it a really good deal. Full price puts it on the expensive side. Two problems. The first was a function of my expectations. I thought that since it was at a vineyard it would be charming. Instead, it was a bigger resort accessed through an industrial park. The second was we were told to go to the concierge for a free gift which was a wine-tasting pass for two along with some good information about the sights. It ended with an offer to sit through a time-share pitch. I am pretty good at resisting so they backed off but I did find it bothersome. Besides the normal wine-tastings, you may want to check out the Oxbow Market, a cool upscale food court. I liked the Venezuelan restaurant, Pica Pica. The second thing to check out is the Uptown Theater which has live music. The Marshall Tucker Band was there one of the nights we were in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great beds”
Reviews.Author: Akocak
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. At first look we were disappointed by the location of the hotel. But once inside the beautiful, new, clean, staff friendly hotel you forget all that. We were not happy with the view from our room because of current constriction which will be completed soon. It took just a short phone call to the front desk and they were happy to upgrade us. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever slept in. While Napa Valley was great we really recommend a visit to the Carneros region. The fire pit at night was a nice touch. Craig at the Concierge's desk was very helpful. We would certainly stay at this hotel again, hopefully next time having time for the beautiful Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great and getting better!”
Reviews.Author: Kcmart
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times and always enjoyed the experience. We love the wine vineyards, cave with spa and wine bar. You won't find this anywhere. They are finishing an expansion with new rooms, balk room etc. but the best part is a new bar with bowling lanes.

Reviews.Title: “great value, but didn't have our room...”
Reviews.Author: Tory L
Reviews.Content: The Mertiage is a great deal and a beautiful property, and I would love to give it a 4 star review. However, I booked and pre-paid for a room with two beds to sleep four guests (bachelorette party), but when we checked in they were unable to give us the room, and instead gave us a one bedroom suite with one bed. The man at the front desk explained that they had no rooms with two beds left (even though it was only 5:30 pm at check-in) and that he was not sure what happened to our room but that this was considered an upgrade. We asked for a rollaway and they were also not able to give us that because of fire safety regulations. Our room was very nice, the pool area was great, and everyone we spoke with was friendly and attentive, but the couch bed was terribly terribly uncomfortable, springy and lumpy. A bad night's sleep and an aching back is not the ideal way to start a day of wine tasting. I won't be back because I can't trust that this wont happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Some bad rooms in this place”
Reviews.Author: LSydell
Reviews.Content: We were up in Napa for an overnight getaway. When we checked in I asked if it was a good room. He nodded and said it was on the first floor by the pool. Ok. Turns out it was lodged between the kitchen and the pool. We were woken up by the sound of clanking dishes. Not cool. They shouldn't rent out that room without a discount. They get kudos for giving me hall off after I complained the next day. But be careful when you book there. Otherwise the place seems clean and pleasant enough for a big napa resort. It's not too far from downtown. And if you get a decent room it should be ok

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: zebo_610
Reviews.Content: We had booked this room through Priceline. I am not sure if this booking service had anything to do with it but we were given a room next to the remodeling and construction area. Upon arrival, the front desk hostess was not very welcoming and did not speak to us until I asked "excuse me, is something wrong?" In her reply, she apologized and that she was reading something. What was frustrating is that we were standing at the desk for a fairly respectable amount of time and she did not acknowledge us. After the first night of stay, we returned early in the evening and the cleaning service did not come and clean the room. We had to call the front desk to ask them if this was an error. They seemed shocked at the complaint, and sent a maid to clean an hour later. When they did arrive, they did not change the sheets, they just remade the bed. This was evident due to our crumbs from breakfast were still in the sheets. Although the resort provided a complimentary bottle of wine, when we went to open it, the wine key had a hard, food, based gunk stuck to it. However, the hotel/resort did provide a shuttle to take people to downtown Napa between the hours of 4-10:30. This was convenient if you are not familiar with the area; it will take you directly to the place you want to go, and the shuttle will come and pick you up where ever you are as long as you can name any point of reference. Overall, I thought it was an average "hotel" with moody and/or lazy hosts/hostesses. The one employee that seemed to have a bit of personality was the bartender as we spent some time talking with her and griping about our stay. Looking back at the trip, it was not that nice of a stay and did not meet the star level advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, wonderful spa, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, once in a regular Queen bed room and once in a room with a balcony. Both rooms were very nice, very clean, lovely large bathrooms, complimentary bottle of wine, comfy bed. The balcony room is quite special overlooking the pool area and vineyard. The service here is exceptional-I entered the bar area and said that I had a question. I was told "the answer is "yes" before I could even ask!!! Justin at the concierge desk is very pleasant and totally helpful. His restaurant recommendation was tailored to our likes. We have also had exceptionally friendly people help us at the front desk (Dolores checked us in and went out of her way to accommodate us). They appear to be trying to minimize the noise from the construction area which is greatly appreciated. Our experiences in the spa area have been a major enjoyment during our stay at the resort. The "cave" has a beautiful and relaxing spa area and provides wonderful spa services. We always look forward to staying here. Our contact with the management has always been very positive and they are very responsive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Aahhhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: SpaJunkiesRUs
Reviews.Content: On our 2nd trip here, we met a wonderful concierge named Justin who was very helpful and steered us to some great restaurants and day trips. On our previous trip, we had another concierge named Rosemary who was equally kind and helpful. Ask for them and they'll steer you towards the places that will be personally appealing. Our balcony room was delightful, and the spa immaculate and worth every penny. We will be back again and again, and cannot recommend the spa and wine cave experience highly enough. Only thing that we would hope they would improve upon is the food in their Sienna restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: VinceSLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Great place in super location. Had balcony upgrade but was a bit disappointed in that they put us into one of two "mini balcony" rooms that face one another. There are larger balcony rooms facing the spa/winery but apparently were unavailable according to the front desk. Also, the hot tub was broken which was a disappointment. Other than that, great place!

Reviews.Title: “Located in a corporate park; not exactly quintessential Napa”
Reviews.Author: BetsyRider
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed to find that this hotel is more like a conference center and is located in a corporate office park at the edge of downtown Napa. Oddly, the Wifi did not work in the room and when we called about it twice, the front desk's response was, "Oh, it often doesn't work with Apple computers." The rooms were comfortable and clean although there was only one hook for towels in the entire bathroom. The entire place felt like it was trying to imitate a spa rather than really being one; it had a pool, a spa, etc., but none of the coziness you'd expect. The breakfasts were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Reservation Service, Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: CantUC
Reviews.Content: Is it possible to be very unhappy with a Resort when you don't even get past making a reservation? I found out today that it is. I purchased a Groupon to stay at the Meritage Resort and Spa for a weekend. The first day that Groupon purchasers were permitted to make a reservation was February 15. I called at 9 a.m. on February 15 to make a reservation since the Groupon was only good until mid-May. Instead of handling my call, they took my name and number and told me that they would call back that day. I was not called back so at 4 p.m. I called back. Once again they would not take my reservation and said that they would call back that day. After several calls to the Meritage on February 16, they called back at about 3:30 p.m. I told them 4 different weekends that I was available to use the Groupon. They told me that there were no Groupon rooms available on any of those weekends even though I called at 9 a.m. on the first day that reservations were accepted. Then came the bait and switch. I was told that if I would pay $50 more a night I could get a room on one of those weekends. I refused to pay the extra money and now I must deal with Groupon to get a refund. Customer service and ethics are obviously low priorities at the Meritage.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Lucy J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property: the rooms are elegant, clean, and spacious. The washrooms are nice - loved the shower setup. We stayed at a 3rd floor suite and had great views of the pool and vineyard. The lobby is nicely layed out. The pool and jacuzzi was very nice and clean. Relaxing experience. Large and beautiful patio on the ground floor with views of the pool. Great for morning coffee or catch up with emails. Free and fast Wifi. There is no where to walk around other than just around the pool. It would have been really nice to have walking path along the vineyard especially after all the dining:) The restaurant (Sian), however was not a good experience. It was average food trying to be Tuscan or something, but just really not well done or tasty. And really over priced for what it was. Fake and pretentious atmosphere. I would recommend eating at the lobby bar if you have to or somewhere off the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fake charm, poorly located, overpriced small rooms, and rude concierge”
Reviews.Author: Bea D
Reviews.Content: What a terrible disappointment. I was so fooled by their website, which seems to advertise a place in the middle of a vineyard, not a place in the middle of a corporate park. This place is more a Marriot/Days Inn type place but more "up-scale". They are also next to this time-share Shell vacation thing that EVERYONE in the hotel is going to try to talk to you about. Ok, so the ambiance was lacking, but we decided to make due. We went down to talk to the concierge and got the worst service ever! Greg, the concierge, was so weirdly rude I was almost convinced it was an act. Although he was mildly helpful, he rushed through the information and seemed only interested in selling you things the hotel had partnerships with. Including this freaking time-share. The cave area was ok, tho they only carry the wine the hotel owner produces. Another indication that they are NOT interested in the best service for you, but selling you products that make them more money. Oh and Greg was not the only rude concierge (it seems like a pre-requisite to being hire there is "do you hate people and life?" "hired!") We came down around 5:30 to get the free shuttle and this lady is sitting in front of her computer, ignores us for a few minutes, this was our interaction: Us - "Hi, we want to take the shuttle to downtown Napa for dinner" Lady - "yeah 6pm" (doesn't even look up) Us - "Do you recommend any restaurants? Lady - "you don't have a reservation!!!" (rolls her eyes) "good luck" (turns back to computer an ignores us. WTF! A helpful concierge would have told me about 5 restaurants that are great and then offered to make us a reservation. "good luck" lady this is your JOB! Added bonus, we checked out and had an extra room service charge on our bill. We didn't make the charge, and it took 20 minutes to sort it out. The guy at the front desk was nice and apologized profusely, but that the cherry on top of a dreadful weekend. If you are looking for fake charm, overpriced small rooms, an obnoxious clientÃ¨le and rude concierge service all in the middle of a parking lot and no where near anything in Napa (inspite the "centrally located" advertisement) then the Meritage is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely weekend vacation”
Reviews.Author: mike f
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful spot and so close to SF too. I took my wife to the Meritage Resort in January and we were so impressed by the level of service and follow-through that the Meritage management and staff showed during our stay. I am a frequent traveller and rarely do I get the level of service shown by the staff and management of Meritage.

Reviews.Title: “The Meritage Management make the trip”
Reviews.Author: Ryan Nackas B
Reviews.Content: WOW we have to say what a great time we had at the Meritage Resort. It was my first time going to a health spa in Napa and I was thoroughly impressed. The Meritage Management is a wonderful bunch of people who will go out of their way to help someone staying at their resort. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “a happy error”
Reviews.Author: JHCWinchester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are booked to stay at the Meritage this weekend. Earlier today I talked with someone over the phone and said I'd call back to make the reservation after checking the arrangement with my daughter and her husband who are joining us. When I called back, I spoke with a different reservations agent and it turned out that the person I had talked with earlier had made a mistake in what she had offered. I was transferred to the front desk and then to a manager who explained there had been a misunderstanding on the part of his staff member, apologized for the complication it had created in making my reservation, and he would honor what I had originally been offered. Everyone makes mistakes, but not everyone resolves them in a way that leaves the customer feeling more positive about the establishment than before. Everyone in this chain of communication was very pleasant and professional, and I appreciate the value they evidently place on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal G
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to get away for a weekend go no further than the Meritage Resort and Spa! The resort is currently undergoing renovations (they are adding an additional 150+ rooms), but it hasn't stopped the flow and beauty of this resort. There's the Estate Cave where there is wine tasting and the Spa is located in the Cave as well. The Spa services are to die for! I did not dine at the Siena Restaurant so I cannot comment on the food. There is also a wine tasting bar in the lobby of the resort (The Estate Wine Bar). The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We had a free bottle of wine waiting for us in our room upon arrival! I would definitely stay there again! The only minus for me was the location. The resort is located in a industrial business district which took a little away from the ambiance. But once you're in the resort, all is forgiven.

Reviews.Title: “A big hug to Meritage”
Reviews.Author: Ron Henry Mille... S
Reviews.Content: Meritage is a wonderful place ' I went there last summer for my wife's birthday and we could not have asked for a better time. I would think that the Meritage Management hears this all the time but their hotel is one of the best ones in Cali. The Meritage staff is a great bunch of warm and giving people who are a gift to the hospitality industry in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss and Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: Our first time at Meritage and we had such a relaxing and soothing time away from the kids, work, tv, etc, etc, etc. First off we had to reschedule our dates due to circumstances beyond our control and Meritage's Management was very accommodating and were helpful in changing out dates without any extra cost. Secondly, there restaurant is delicious and elegant. We wish we had something like that in Salt Lake City. A big thanks to all the staff and Meritage's management. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The management at Meritage need to go to McCollege”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySacks D
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Meritage for our anniversary thinking we could have a romantic weekend but the management at Meritage took every opportunity to thrust their policies and rules and regulations into our romance and privacy. They were the most intrusive set of people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. The management of Meritage would be better off in another industry other than hospitality. There is nothing hospitable about Meritage or their parental-acting management.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: First time at the Meritage, here on business. It is in a commercial area which is strange driving in, but once you're on-property it's fine. Our initial room was in the Merlot building. Gorgeous, spacious suite with an outdoor patio. Fridge, microwave, washer-dryer, the works. Only one problem. No Wi-Fi. Since the building is pretty new I am sure they will offer Wi-Fi in the future but no Internet access, for a business traveler, simply doesn't work. Long story short, we're moved to a new room in the main building. Nice-sized room, but no microwave nor patio. Great view of the pool, vines, and entrance to the Trinitas wine cave. And, with Wi-Fi, a superb room indeed. Side note here: the staff is phenomenal. Manny at the bell desk was not only absolutely helpful in bringing all of our luggage from one room to the next, he also was kind enough to go retrieve some toiletries I'd left behind in the first room due to not being able to focus because the fire alarm was going off inside the whole Merlot building (story for another time, but it wasn't me. Honestly). The bar in the main building (don't know if it has a name, just off the lobby on the left-hand side), true to form, provided excellent service. Our server was there whenever we wanted to order another round, or dinner, but never hovered. Nor did she appear so busy that we were forgotten, and the place got pretty busy as the World Series was being broadcast on the telly above the bar. Room-service breakfast: we each ordered the Eggs Meritage. Like Benedict, but atop a disc of polenta. Again, great staff interaction - they were friendly to a fault and let us know exactly how long it would be before our food arrived. Great folks you have, Meritage, hopefully you pay them well. Breakfast was good - not phenomenal, but overall 3 stars. The Trinitas wine cave: there was a special business function in the wine cave where three local wineries were offering tasting - the cave is gorgeously lit and very cozy, considering its size. Great venue. There was a special dinner afterward for thirty folks (no invite for me) and the long table, set with snow-white linens, glistening flatware and glassware and gorgeous tapered candles looked striking. What an amazing spot for a special dinner! Perhaps next time... Room-service dinner: I ordered a green salad, Steak Frites and Jack Daniels bread pudding. Green salad: good stuff - mostly greens, few beet chunks, few halved cherry tomatoes. Nice light dressing. Steak Frites: holy hell. Gooooood stuff. I am a meat elitist and turn my nose up at anything that even hints at fat and gristle. This hunk 'o' meat was perfectly prepared, sliced, and honest to goodness, I completely cleaned my plate. The frites: thin, perfectly cooked, some were translucent in all their glory. Wow. The only disappointment was the bread pudding. On the dry side, it could have used about 5x the sauce. I tasted apricots. I tasted good bread pudding egginess. I did NOT, however, taste Jack Daniel's. Anywhere near the plate. No hint of bourbon warmth, nothing whatsoever. If I'd know I was going to get plain old bread pudding, I would've gone with the chocolate. Argh. I know that dessert can be iffy for a kitchen as it is overall omitted from the meal, but for those of us dessert-lovers, it can make or break the meal. It is, literally, the last thing your patrons are going to taste before they leave your restaurant and as such, it needs to be "holy-crap-I-want-to-wallow-in-this" good. My bread pudding was lacking. Things to keep in mind: this location is not Napa-proper. It's south of the general "Napa" area and not really centrally located to anything other than the industrial park. That said, these folks did a great job with the location they chose. From our third-floor room, the view is nothing but big, azure pool, wine cave, and vines as far as you can see. If I didn't know better, you'd not have any inclination that you were in a commercial area.

Reviews.Title: “The Meritage's Management are great hosts”
Reviews.Author: Deb S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove down to the Meritage from Salt Lake City last fall, and when we arrived the Meritage's management greeted us graciously and were quite hospitable. We stayed at the Meritage for almost a week before heading back to Salt Lake City. Great place to stay and say hi to the Meritage's management for us. Steve and Deb, Salt Lake City

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimu007
Reviews.Content: They have a restaurant in cave and it is awesome! Good food and wine too.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, nice value, location only downfall”
Reviews.Author: dfkcluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a three day Napa wine tour in early November. Price was great, just under $200 a night but we gave up some in location. Well worth it even if it added a little drive time to Yountville and the wine regions north of there. They offer a free van shuttle at night to downtown Napa which was nice, I think from 5:30pm - 10:30pm or so. The property is a little spread out so you may have a walk to your room. Friendly small bar, one restaurant which was fine for breakfast. Nice pool area which I believe was heated along with a hot tub. They have their own little vineyard, wine cave and spa as well. Very nice boutique property. This hotel is in a business park area so I can see it being more of a business stay property but again, it worked well for our group looking to avoid a $400 a night stay. We used Pure Luxury out of Sonoma for our mini bus transportation and they were fantastic. Friendly staff, clean property, small work out room but ok. Looks like a new wing being built. Definitely a winner for a business meeting and very acceptable for leisure. Charming property.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Safari”
Reviews.Author: 1pelagic
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in the Napa Valley visiting the many great vineyards. Our stay was at the Meritage Resort. This property is an excellent operation and the personnel were great and most helpful in all respects. We will be guests there again!

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail was unexpected and very welcome!”
Reviews.Author: Laurence T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Meritage Hotel for out 19th wedding anniversary and loved all the little extra details that you don't get very often anywhere else. From the moment we checked in we were greeted with a smile and "Happy anniversary...." We also got a special card, some chocolate, wine and more smiles for our special occasion..... We loved the service and food at "Siena" and the wine tasting at the Trinity tasting room. The stroll trough the vineyards was also beautiful..... The only negatives were the lumpy pillows and the smallness of the room and that is why I did not give an excellent on everything.

Reviews.Title: “A mini-vacation with the husband”
Reviews.Author: Honeyp13
Reviews.Content: The Meritage is a lovely Italian feeling resort. We have stayed there three times over the last few years. I, particularly, love the under ground spa, it feels so timeless. The steam room is very nice and very clean. The room had a mini kitchen which we used and enjoyed having. I got a horse back ride in the Sonoma hills that was great and would recommend doing this if you love horses, vineyards and views of the Sonoma valley. We are going back this year. We liked the restaurant and they had very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MEG7213
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at The Meritage after a few rave reviews from family and friends that had stayed there in the past. From the start we had problems...On our first attempt to make reservations, my husband was put on hold and hung up after being on hold for more than ten minutes. We both have little patience for businesses that do this, but still went back for more. While on trip advisorâ€™s website, we clicked on a link that offered deals for The Meritage, called the number provided and once my husband realized he was not speaking to the hotel directly, he politely explained to the person on the other end that he would prefer to speak with the hotel directly and would call them, this person said, "F_CK YOU" and hung up on him! Now we realize the hotel is not fully responsible for this, but this is a company that makes reservations on their behalf, which means that they are representing the hotel. After all of this we still decided to make reservations. While speaking to the reservationist we were put on hold once again, for her to verify that she could match the price that we saw online, normally this wouldn't be a bother, but it took a while and if you are the reservationist on regular basis, this should be something that you are aware. We check in without incident. That was probably the most pleasant experience. The first morning of our vacation, we are awakened at 6:30AM, by a chirping battery from the smoke detector. It is very frustrating to be awakened that early while on vacation. The hotel is responsible for staying up to date on the maintenance of smoke detectors and such. Food at the hotel bar was bad at best. Worst of all, the concierge desk was downright rude and unfriendly. One thing that I thought was unusual is that when you entered and exited the hotel, they would give you direct eye contact but not speak, unless spoken to and unresponsive to a friendly smile. This is in direct contrast to what I accustomed to from a concierge desk! All these minor things on their own would not have been a big deal, but when you add it all up, it makes for a less than desirable stay. In the end I complained to the manager on duty, who was pleasant, but somewhat full of excuses. We were given a fifty dollar credit, of course to spend back at the hotel, which I have mixed feelings about. All in all, not a great place to spend our Christmas break.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Martha M
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at the Meritage four times and anticipate that we'll stay there again when we return to Napa. If you can get a good rate, it's worth every penny. Google and shop around. Hold out for specials and you'll get WELL MORE than your money's worth. Your room will have water and wine waiting when you arrive..and if you're like most people, you'll be spending a lot of time touring. The rooms are nice and clean and the Eggs Meritage is a breakfast that draws me in even when I'm not staying here. Only complaint would be that in parts of the hotel the walls are thin and the floors are "thin" too. You'll hear your upstairs neighbors walking around. It's worth asking for a higher floor if you're a light sleeper. Free coffee by the elevators. A nice free shuttle to downtown Napa. Gorgeous views and a gorgeous courtyard. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with cleanliness issues”
Reviews.Author: nova5star
Reviews.Content: Room is basic and on surface appeared clean but I found dark hair on the blanket (I am blonde) as well as huge amounts of dark hair stuck on the shower wall. Coffee pot was not clean either.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: Gilles L
Reviews.Content: Hidden fees. I hated to see a $15/day appear on my invoice as a Resort fee. It seems that this addition is not identified much anywhere. Booking.com did not highlight it either. Concierge service is there essentially to bring us to a sales pitch for something like timesharing. Don't call them concierge if they are not. The room they gave us was directly on the exit of the kitchens, so we were never tempted to open the curtains. The bath is very high, which makes it difficult to enter and exit when you want to take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort. Look forward to staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: BermudaCoelho
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Napa with my husband and two other couples. The Meritage is about 10 mins away from downtown Napa. However, the resort has a complimentary transport to downtown. They will take you and pick you up within their time schedule. Great resort. Friendly staff particular the chefs in the restaurant who would come out and talk to guests and even help wait staff. (Impressed). There is complimentary coffee every morning outside the elevator and it is delicious. The spa is amazing. You want to spend the day in there. We had couples message and facials each. Amazing. Time flies in the spa. The treatment rooms and relaxing room are very cosy and the showers and locker rooms were effeciently maintained both womens and men. Our resort room overlooked the pool and grape planatation and had a veranda where we would enjoy our coffee. Victoria at the concierge desk was very helpful booking us into some amazing restaurants for dinner. The resatuarants in Napa are amazing serving fresh, tastefull foods. The only disappointment was the gym was small with only a couple of machines of which some were not working however the resort is expanding and is putting in a bigger gym. I would definately recommend this resort and look forward to staying there soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in wine country”
Reviews.Author: kridhm
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Napa. I went with my husband. It was awesome to stay between grape plantation. We had window view towards pool and grape plantation. Place was very good to stay and relax but one thing for which I didnt gave excellent is that it does not serve food for Indians in lunch and dinner as we have to manage ourself by going to downtown. We spent 5 days over there. The room service was very good. The breakfast they served was really very healthy. It was a good experience. The location is far away ffrom downtowm Napa as it takes 15-20 min in car.It gives facilities like Gym, Jakuzi.

Reviews.Title: “It may be slightly off the beaten path, but it is worth it...and tall people will love the showers”
Reviews.Author: Puppylady
Reviews.Content: The facility IS what appears to be in an industrial park area, but the grounds are lovely with plenty of FREE parking! The lobby is luxuriously inviting. The staff at check-in were friendly and efficient. Our room was quite away from the elevator, but upon entering the room we loved it. Our view from the window was off the pool area and vineyard. The room had everything you need; fridge, which had complimentary water, a coffee pot, cups, coffee, wine glasses, opener, and a complimentary bottle of wine. There were thick terry robes, plenty of towels. There were double sinks and the toilet was in its own room w a door. The shower was large w great water pressure. However, the shower-head must have been 7 ft high & when you are 4'11", is problematic trying to reach, but if you are tall you will LOVE it. The robe hook was just as high and the sinks felt higher than the norm....which is just an observation. They include a hairdryer and even cotton balls and swabs. We ate breakfast at the Sienna one monring. The prices were moderate and the wait staff were great. One morning we wanted the newspaper and in minutes the paper was at our door. We visited the bar a couple of times and each time the staff were friendly and attentive, however prices a little high. 1-bottle of Lagunitas IPA, and a cup of tea was $13. They have a beautiful pool area, a cave w Spa facilities, & wine tasting room. Because they are a bit of a drive from downtown Napa, they have a FREE shuttle starting @ 5pm and leaves every 1/2 hour until 10. The only thing we did not like was the concierge. We approached them to help with a place for dinner on our second night. All they focused on was they had been "trying to reach us" "they have this promotion" "when are we leaving".....well the shuttle arrived and we had to leave....without any names of places for dinner. After we checked out and were walking out the concierge again jumped to the "oh just checking in"? "we have these promotions". We said nope we just checked out. I really liked this facility and WOULD recommend it. I would love to go back in the summer to take advantage of the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at The Meritage Resort in Napa. I'm a local writer, and have had the opportunity to experience some of the finest resorts in Napa Valley over the years. The Meritage was above and beyond my expectations. My family came in from out of town for a wedding. My father, who recently had a stroke and is diabetic, made the trip. The staff went out of their way to accommodate him. Both mornings I ordered room service for him, and was told there was an hour's wait. When I explained his medical situation, his food arrived within minutes. Amazing! My husband and I arrived at the hotel early on a Friday morning to visit with family, and planned to check in at 4:00. The front office staff found a room that was ready and we were able to check in before noon. And we were in a room just down the hall from my father's! Staff members on every level seem to genuinely enjoy working at the resort. It was refreshing to walk through the beautifully appointed resort and receive gracious smiles from everyone. Free coffee service in the morning was delightful! I didn't have time to take advantage of the spa in the caves, but being local, I plan to secure a massage appointment soon. Everything about the resort was five-star. I hope someone else gets married or visits soon so I have the opportunity to stay there again. A true vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Time Share”
Reviews.Author: martha20102010
Reviews.Content: when you check in, the front desk gives you a card to pick up your "packet" at the conceirge. sounds nice, eh? nope, just a scam to try to sell you a time share. We quickly refused and the conceirge was ticked. Really silly - made us feel unwelcome. So beware! Don't fall for that trick. it is in an office park and if you like to run, drive somewhere b/c running is almost impossible with no sidewalks. pool is great and so is hot tub. work out facility pretty nice too. breakfast - try the eggs meritage or granola and yogurt. maria, the server is best. get coffee first at elevators - then you don't have to pay for it at breakfast. best thing we did - got a limo driver for the day - Woody from Beau Tours. Awesome awesome fun. took us to Pinot Noir area of Sonoma County - Gary Ferrel was incredible - views and server, and for lunch, don't miss Aioli west of Santa Rosa. Deviled eggs and burger were the best we had during our stay. Avoid the wine train - chees-E!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Agnes W
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel for those visiting the wine country, it truly feels like you are in wine country resort. The hotel is beautifully decorated with many amenities. Pool area is relaxing and rooms are spacious. I love the vineyard in the back. We took the self guided tour around the vineyard one morning. Service was amazing, especially Joe at the front desk. We had a problem with the check-in date but he fixed the problem for us. He was really courteous and offered us water while we were waiting. He went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. They also offer a free shuttle service to downtown Napa. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “C-”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at best. My first morning there I awoke to someone power washing right outside out bedroom window at 8:30 am!! it lasted for several hours and after calling the front desk to complain they still kept going. Our room must have been connected to a smoker's room because it stunk of cigarettes. Construction was going on next door too. The location is really not idea either. It's 20 min for Napa valley and all the good restaurants...It's sort of off of the highway. Feel bad giving anyone a bad review but this place really earned it. If we had to do it over again we would definitely NOT stay at the Meritage Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort hotel in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: carreokie
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa. Just my husband and I. We stayed 4 nights. We ate in the restaraunt for breakfast and had two dinners. The food was good. The rooms are clean and nice. There is only wifi in the lobby but there is internet in the room and cables to connect in the desk. The pool area and hot tub were nice. Cute little lime trees around the pool. Didn't use the spa but did pop in to check out the wine cave. The guys there are nice and if you buy a bottle or bring the free bottle from your room to the restraunt there is no corkage fee. The staff is very friendly and service oriented. Room was ready on arrival. Concierge was very helpful with directions and booking us a reservation at the Chop House restaraunt. That place is FABULOUS!! Had drinks in the lobby bar while waiting for the shuttle to take us downtown. Great service. The shuttle runs from 5-10pm every night and it is free. It is a few minutes from downtown but a very convenient location if you are driving to visit wineries. It is a resort hotel, it is not a cute bed and breakfast. So if you are after cute and nostalgic this place located near a business park may be a disappointment We had a wonderful stay here and can't say enough about the great staff here. Oh, little tip: There is free coffee in the lobby area and $7.00 coffee in the restaraunt It is the same great coffee. .

Reviews.Title: “A true resort in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: Jody A
Reviews.Content: The Meritage Resort is perfect for those looking for a true resort versus a B&B or economy hotel in Napa. The resort is pristine, the rooms are comfortable, and the bed and pillows were like sleeping on a cloud! Our room overlooked the vineyard, the pool area was so relaxing and we had two meals - breakfast and lunch, both were delicious. We plan to visit again so we can try the spa and have dinner at the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Bergie518
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay in Napa. We had never been to wine country before and we loved it. We had a room that looked out to the winery and the weather was great while we were there so we could hangout side on our balcony. We love that a shuttle takes you into downtown each night so you can have dinner in downtown napa without driving and the shuttle driver was so nice. Everyone was friendly. We would recommend the hotel. We swam and played bocci ball while there in between our many wine tastings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort Property in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Andaltex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had four nice days at the Meritage, while I was attending a conference there. This is a relatively new, comprehensive property that is far from "cookie cutter". We had a nice sized room overlooking vineyards; the bed was very comfortable and all expected amenities, including free wireless, were provided. We especially enjoyed the hotel bar, where items from Siena, the resort restaurant are served. The staff was helpful, and we had no issues during the stay. The meeting facilities were quite good for the type of conference I attended (about 200 persons). The conference center is adjacent to the Vineyard Terrace and pool, where we had perfectly delicious seated lunches. I'd be happy to return for a meeting here, or to have a hand in scheduling one here. The property is located south of Napa, so a car is helpful. We did use the resort shuttle to town for a meal one evening and found that quite convenient. This is a nice property, well suited for visitors of all ages, including families with children; we'd be happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back! L.O.V.E.D The Meritage!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrangTeam
Reviews.Content: My husband whisked me away for my Birthday and from the moment we got there they we extremely accommodating! They even had a Happy Birthday card and chocolates delivered to our room right after we arrived as well as posted a Happy Birthday announcement to me in the front. The concierge helped us with coupons and directions for vineyards. We walked through the onsite vineyard every morning and while we didn't get to take advantage of the spa or tasting room, we did look inside of them and they were INCREDIBLE! Our upgraded suite was AMAZING (can you say jacuzzi tub and AMAZINGLY comfortable beds?!). The food and bar were excellent. The workout room was enough (not super fancy, but was still able to get a workout in). I would also highly recommend Hidden Napa Jeep Tours for an AMAZING, PRIVATE tour of Napa (www.HiddenNapa.com). It was our first time in Napa and definitely not our last. We will be back. Thank you Meritage for making this such a fabulous trip!

Reviews.Title: “bad location but everything else was very good”
Reviews.Author: theatregoer002
Reviews.Content: stayed here with spouse on business. i am a jogger/ walker but there is no place to do either...surrounded by freeways with the connection of a very small business park.... so in the future will try to stay in a more scenic area where you don't have to take the car to go anywhere. other than that...very nice staff, room was nice and the rate was good. lobby attractive, etc. so you won't be disappointed if you don't care about being able to walk outside your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth Staying At”
Reviews.Author: lauryn_373
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disapointment. I am not one to complain as I make the best out of every situation but before booking this hotel, please consider: - The rooms are totally out dated and the walls were so dusty. I feel like it needed a really good scrubbing before we got there - The conceirge was rude every time I asked about something I was treated like an inconvienience - The food and drinks were over priced and not good at all. I have no problem paying $15 for a cocktail but it must at least be good - The premises feels totally outdated - Pool was okay but you must bring your own towels and there is no wait staff for food/drink by the pool - Location is terrible (can't walk ANYWHERE...even to buy a bottle of water) - Problem getting the room cleaned (after calling 4 times they finally came).

Reviews.Title: “First tour of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Pat P
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful introduction to the beauty of Napa and all its fantastic wineries at the Meritage. We enjoyed fun and interesting tastings in the Trinitas tasting room with knowledgeable staff, plus one of the best massages I ever experienced in the Spa Terra, complete with an unexpected glass of champagne at the conclusion. Staff was very accommodating, our room overlooking the pool and vineyard was relaxing. All on all a fun time for all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you are not looking for a B and B.”
Reviews.Author: I_love_trips
Reviews.Content: We prefer bigger hotels with lots to offer over a B and B. Our last trip to Napa was at a B and B and this time we were traveling with other couples and thought the Meritage worked out perfectly. There was a nice pool/hot tub, spa, bocce court, on-site vineyard and tasting room. We enjoyed lots of outdoor areas to sit/lounge. The location was a bit far south, so if you are looking to be more central, this isn't it. We enjoyed the hotel shuttle and used it many times into downtown Napa for dinner. You have to drive to go elsewhere. The restaurant service at breakfast was slow most days, but very curteous. Our room usually wasn't cleaned until late in the day, but it seemed like they were cleaning the empty rooms first, so makes sense, I guess. We had a patio room with an amazing view...highly recommend! It is located in an office park, so know that before booking...there is nowhere to walk to, although I did run along the windy road of the office park. The spa was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pet friendly place in Napa”
Reviews.Author: VeelaVeela
Reviews.Content: In the past, pet friendly options in Napa Valley gave been limited to bad rooms at Embassy Suites, a few rooms in B&Bs, and hotels with very expensive pet fees. The Meritage fills this void with nice rooms at a reasonable price for Napa and a $50 per stay fee. The Good: South Napa location makes it an easy commute from the bay area. Siena restaurant was nice and tasty. The hotel is surrounded by vineyards. Large conference facilities. Staff is super friendly. Beds are comfortable and patio is nice. Pet friendly. The bad: Our "vineyard" view room directly overlooked a draiage ditch (see pic). Currently the hotel is adding wings, so it is under construction. In rooms facing construction, you may awaken to the noise. Room felt small for the cost. $50 pet fee is charged regardless of size of dog or length of stay. The Ugly: The layout of the room is poor. The closet and bathroom open out, so you are constantly dodging doors. The separate toilet room door also opens outwards so if bashes into anyone using the right sink. Overall, a pleasant stay with fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: mrssusanbradley
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Meritage....nicely appointed room with a balcony overlooking the pool, wineyard and spa. Had a delicious dinner at the Siena Restaurant (far exceeded our dinner the one night at The Fish Story). The couples massage at Spa Terra was definitely a highlight, from the service to the tranquil and luxurious surroundings...the service everywhere was excellent...every person we dealt with was friendly and helpful...The location was perfect to wine tasting in every direction. The hotel also has a shuttle service in the evening to Napa so you can enjoy all the wine you want! There is a lot of construction going on right now as they enlarge...but since are room was well away from it we were not effected at all....anxious to see the new addition when it is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dsully10
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in Napa for our girlfriends birthday. We love the hotel and bar area!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Trip Back-Loved it Again!”
Reviews.Author: Chappy1550
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to tell you how much I love the Meritage. We stayed for 4 nights on September 11-15th. We had wonderful weather and our room with a balcony view over the pool was just what we booked back in April. We had many choices and decisions to pick another hotel but my husband and I fell in love with this place and really wanted to visit. From the bed linens and comfy beds to the atmosphere outside by the pool and the wine cave....We did not have robes in our room and when we called the front desk -the robes were delivered still warm and comfy from the dryer immediately. My husband purchased a spa treatment and what an experience that was in the Spa Terra for my birthday...Wow -you have to try it...First Class all the way....Very soothing and relaxing....My sister and her husband traveled here from NY and was very impressed with the atmosphere of the resort. I loved the exceptional service and how friendly everyone was - as they were 2 years ago. I just can't say enough of how wonderful this place is. ....I would love to come back when the new construction is done. My only complaint is I wish they had bagels or danishes with the morning coffee. But it was a great way to start your day and was very sad to leave. A quick suggestion is that the outside pool area have a bartender during the week. We really liked having that option when out at the pool area but seemed like it was closed during the week. I definitely recommend walking the pathway to the Wine Guy Statue..Very scenic and romantic. I cannot wait to revisit the new facility and be pampered and spoiled all over....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but on the outskirt of town.”
Reviews.Author: VB_Local_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has clean, spacious rooms. We booked through priceline so we got a really great rate. I had a "Hot Stone" massage which was alright, however the masseur kept dropping the stones, so it was hard to relax. Dinner in the restaurant was delicious. All things considered, it was a nice hotel and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa, but the place is on the waaaay South end of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Allonsey
Reviews.Content: Loved the spa! Book in advance as it fills up. The place is rather average looking and is actually in a business park. If you look at the website, you would think they are in the heart of wine country. Theya re actually south of Napa the city and are not really close to the actual wine country. It feels like a business hotel that tries to bill itself as a retreat in wine country. It's not bad, I just think people ought to know what they are getting into if they go here. Oh, the rooms are pretty quiet if you unplug the refrigerator in the room. Hard beds. Friendly staff but ordinary food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wine + Great Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: The Meritage Resort is in a great location in Napa at the south end of the Valley. It is well located for those interested in serious wine tasting excursions. They also have a magnificent Cave that has great wine tasting and one of the best spa's I've ever been to. It is the perfect place to return to after a long day in the vineyards. They also have a great breakfast there to get you ready for the vino. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Shan78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2 year anniversary. The hotel was very nice and our room was great. The bed was really comfortable and all the amenities were provided. Our room had a jacuzzi bathtub, which was really nice and relaxing after a full day of wine-tasting. The location itself wasn't that great. We were surprised it was located in a business park right off the highway, but it wasn't too far from all the wineries, so it wasn't too far out of the way. They have a spa and their own winery in a cave behind the pool, which was beautiful, and a trail that goes through their vineyards, which we went on a run through. We would stay here again if we found another good deal. Otherwise, it's pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: STAR22CEB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and staff couldn't have been nicer. The rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed everything about this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: InloveOregon
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we enjoyed our stay. Arriving late in the afternoon we got there just in time for the free wine tasting offered in the wine cave at 5 pm. Along with the wine tasting was unlimited amounts of gourmet cheeses, fruits, and crackers. It appeared as much tasting as one would like to do was accommodated. Back at the room we were given a wonderful bottle of red wine that is now one of our favorites and we will look for this wine for purchase in our home state. Two bottles of complimentary water are left in the refrigerator for guests each day and valet parking is free (or should I say included in your $15 a day resort fee). Our room was lovely, every inch decorated beautifully and not one speck of dust or anything out of place. Our bed was comfortable and the pillows just right! The furniture was lovely, the closet and bathroom space were more than ample. I particularly loved finding this hotel is savvy enough to accommodate women by providing a wall mounted magnifying make-up mirror in the bathroom- WOW. We opted for no view thus had the new building under construction outside our window but we weren't in our room much and we didn't hear any particularly unsettling noise from it. I LOVED getting up each morning and walking the paths around the vineyards and my husband found it easy to use the business center with free internet. The food in the restaurant was very good, we had my daughter's rehearsal dinner there and everyone was very happy with our entrees, especially the sea bass. The downside if any is that the gorgeous but very large wooden doors used to enter the double sinked bathroom shower area and then one more to enter the private commode area seem a bit in the way but doable to work around. I was confused why the shower fan was in the private commode instead of the large room accommodating the shower and it came on everytime one used the commode and it was loud enough to be annoying for those brief moments. To keep the bathroom steam free we left the bathroom door open to the bedroom area. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to friends. The shampoos, soaps, and lotions provided were butter based, very nice. It is only a short drive to downtown Napa and on into the wine country. The office park setting made zero difference to staying at this resort other than entering through it to find the resort. Some of our wedding party stayed next door at the Vino Bello when the Meritage became sold out and it was lovely too. We didn't use the pool but they had the most luxurious cushions on the pool furniture I have ever seen. The lobby and patio areas had drop dead gorgeous furniture and beautiful orientals. All staff were absolutely delightful every time we spoke to any of them. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL POSING AS A RESORT - over-rated.”
Reviews.Author: sassysister
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some refining. Although the photos make it look spectacular, its in the middle of an industrial park, far enough away from the luxuries that Napa has to offer, however the hotel does run a shuttle service until 10:30pm @ night. When we arrived, we were told to see the concierge for our 'welcome package'. This 'welcome package' was actually a sales pitch for a timeshare option and if we joined a 90 minute meeting, they would give us a trip to Hawaii, etc. We thought it was a totally bizarre way for them to start us off at the hotel. No directions were provided as to where anything was. Room was spacious but we didn't realize it until the next day that they had booked us into a handicap room (which we didn't need). The shower and the makeup mirror were oddly strange heights. When we attempted to call down to discuss, we were kept on hold for almost 10 minutes and finally when someone answered, we were told a manager would speak with us...it is now day 3 and we still haven't heard from the manager and we've been to the front desk 3 times to complain about other issues we've had here. The customer service is lacking - although they are courteous and willing to help, they never actually resolve anything at all. We had booked a car service for the day and when they arrived to our hotel, they were told that we were not listed with the hotel as guests. When we discussed this with the front desk, again we were told management would get back to us and still nothing. They did offer to look into changing our room and suggested we pack up our stuff before we were to head out for the day, but due to the staff suggesting to our wine tour service that we were not registered here, we were unable to gather our items before we left since we were late. Also every time we tried to call the concierge from our room, we were directed to another guest's room who was getting call after call looking for the front desk. Obviously some glitches they need to work through. If you want a hotel that caters to large conference groups, this is the spot to go to. Its a nicely decorated Holiday Inn. With so many places to stay in Napa, keep doing your research unless you're into this kind of hotel. Not worth the value - spa is grossly over-priced and they also charge a resort fee daily which, given there are no immenities that warrant it. They even charge an additional fee of $25 to use the water therapies at the spa - which is a joke. Although the spa is nice, the writeup of what is available makes it sound over the top. This is a hotel posing as a resort. Don't be fooled. The beds are also lumpy and way too soft. When I went to the spa for a massage, my therapist told me that the number one complaint from guests is the mattress and poor sleep due to terrible mattress quality. This place is over-rated and over-priced for what you get and the location.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury hotel away from traffic”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: We loved the setting. Our room was deluxe in every respect. We found the room very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kerander
Reviews.Content: I was here for a girls weekend of wine tasting. We originally booked a room at the Vino Bello resort next door since it was less expensive, but we were upgraded to a room at the Meritage at check in. We enjoyed the breakfast and concierge services. Also, on Friday afternoons they have wine tasting in the lobby. We went to the Meritage spa on Sunday morning and we found it to be very overpriced for the massage that each of us received. The Meritage is located about 7-8 minutes from downtown Napa and the resort runs a free shuttle bus in the evenings. Overall, it was a really nice hotel, but we weren't really there that much, so I wouldn't stay here again unless I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort for two meetings and enjoyed my stay. The room was spacious, the bathroom was huge and all of the amenities were great. They even had a bottle of wine and a couple bottles of water for me to enjoy in the room which was a very nice treat. I had breakfast and dinner at their restaurant, Siena, and had great service during both meals and was made to feel welcome and comfortable even when eating dinner by myself. The resort also features a pool, spa, wine tasting room and has vineyards. I took a few minutes to walk around the vineyards and read about the different grapes they grow on the property and even jumped in the pool right before a meeting. When I go next time I want to play bocce ball. In addition to all the great services they currently have they are expanding and adding more rooms and will even have bowling! I look forward to my next visit to Napa and The Meritage.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous and Special"”
Reviews.Author: KTaweel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous outside and in. Tucked away behind a business park, it has a gourmet restaurant, sumptuous spa, wine tasting room/store, and beautifully furnished rooms and suites. It is so well located to enjoy Napa and the surrounding vineyards and attractions of the Napa Valley. Truly one of the best places I've ever stayed in Napa and I would return anytime! The concierge team is also extremely accommodating and makes superb recommendations for places to visit and dine.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CookieCattaneo
Reviews.Content: Maybe you can have better luck.... Her recommendation was: Wonderful! The staff welcomed us with smiles. The room was beautiful and had everything we could possibly need in it. The restaurant was great. The complimentary Shuttle Bus to and from Napa and the hotel, was such a good idea. We used it several times. Great hotel! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Napa, but somewhat disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Rose F
Reviews.Content: A group of girlfriends and I decided to head to Napa for a weekend of wine tasting and found that the majority of hotels in Napa were fully booked or insanely expensive on the days we were going to be there. We finally settled on the Meritage Resort and Spa, as it looked very nice and wasn't going to break the bank. I have to say that the setting of the hotel was not exactly what I expected. It is located in a quasi-industrial area just off the highway and is a fair distance from downtown Napa. However, the hotel does offer a free shuttle to take to you and from Napa (until about 10 pm). The hotel itself is very nice, and rooms were spacious and modern, with comfortable beds. We were given a complimentary bottle of wine, which was a nice touch. Additionally, they offer complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby, which is nice if you need a little pick me up throughout the day, There is a lounge and a restaurant on site. The restaurant served a very good breakfast and dinner, however they seemed very short staffed every day we were there. Our breakfast took over an hour to get two days in a row and the people at the table next to us (who arrived before us) never even received their food at all. The staff were very nice and were extremely apologetic about the wait, even reducing our bill by 50%, which we appreciated. One thing I took issue with was having to pay the hotel's mandatory' resort fee'. This hotel hardly qualifies as a resort in my opinion. The pool, while nice, is nothing special and there were few other amenities to warrant this charge. That being said, there is spa and a wine cave that does tastings on site. There is also a trail behind the hotel that winds through a vineyard and looked as though it would be a lovely walk, however it was closed the entire time we were there, which was disappointing. C'est la vie! The hotel seems to host quite a few conferences, and I think it would be a great venue to hold meetings.Staff was very friendly and helpful, and our fellow hotel guests were lovely as well. All in all, the Meritage was a nice hotel and made for a mostly enjoyable place to spend a girls' weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average place--cheap for Napa but overpriced based on what you get”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell C
Reviews.Content: Really more of a place for meetings than getaways. It was nice but would rather have paid more and gotten my money's worth. Pool and hot tub were nice but no different than an average hotel. We are not spa users. Wine tasting room not really a big deal that it is in a cave (a "fake" cave--for a real cave tasting experience go to Deerfield Family Ranch in Sonoma). Room smelled moldy. No real upscale amenitites--had to call to get a shower cap. Restaurant was very good for dinner and VERY understaffed for the Sunday brunch. Liked the dinner better than Cuvee in town. Front desk staff was nice and accomodating. Free coffee and water was nice in the morning but we get that on business trips with pretty much any hotel now. Setting is pretty even though the complex is in a business park. Major plus is that it is really close if you are driving from the Sacramento area and easy access to wineries. If had to do it over again would be just as happy at Embassy Suites in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not a "destination" hotel”
Reviews.Author: srlndstrm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a recent drive down the West Coast. This is a nice hotel that is clean and feels new. It is decorated in a rustic Mediterranean feel. Our room was huge with a large bed and included a complimentary bottle of wine. There was a lovely pool area with a firepit (but the fire was out before 10pm, kind of a bummer). The people at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little bit out of the main Napa town area, so there isn't a ton in the area for a leisure/vacation traveler. However, this does seem like a really good hotel to hold a conference at. I'm not sure I'd come here as a "destination" though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: enjoylifenow14
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary at the resort and absolutely loved the entire weekend. The Meritage is very well appointed and the staff is very attentive. They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and part of the family. The Friday night complimentary wine tasting and appetizers was a very nice touch to start the weekend off. We had dinner reservations downtown and the shuttle was the best way to travel. Pickup and delivery were easy as could be and very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Relax to the Max”
Reviews.Author: accuracy_counts
Reviews.Content: The Meritage is paired with Trinitas Winery and Spa making this destination ideally suited for a getaway from the bustle of work/city. The Meritage staff is cued into the traveler; lunching by the pool or breakfast with their exquisite poached eggs over herbed polenta or simple but delicious chef's favorite granola, it makes for a foodie's delight. The spa offers an expansive menu of options highly recommended, if this isn't budgeted tho, just utilizing soothing benefits of the free spa/sauna, followed by a 14-jet shower to begin your night out on the town is highly recommended. The free shuttle to Napa downtown is rewarding to take in the restaurants, shops and boutiques, in addition to the chefs'/farmers' market. Dining and drinking at night with leisure is a plus as no driving is req'd. I was there to take in a Napa experience, the concierge shared several buy 1, get 1 tastings. Tasting without a crowd is highly recommended, I was able to meet several winemakers just by going early. Michael Mondavi - true testament to the anti-aging concepts in winemaking and being a hands-on performer. The rooms at the Meritage are spacious and they've not spared any detail.
